raw_response:
Brik is visually characterized by a very thin, lacy, and delicate **crispy pastry shell**, about 1mm thick, called "malsouka," that is golden-brown after deep or shallow frying[3][5]. It is typically **folded into a triangular shape**, enclosing the filling securely to prevent escape during frying[1][7][8].

The consistency of brik as served is **crunchy and brittle on the outside** due to the deep frying of the thin pastry, while the interior is **soft and rich**. Traditional versions contain w
